intro: Stachys betonica, commonly known as betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces spikes of blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Betony is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along roadsides. It has been historically used in herbal medicine for its purported calming and healing properties.
